sentence: To determine if there exists an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for some integer \( n \), we start by analyzing the expression \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \).

sentence: We will evaluate \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) for \( n = 0, 1, 2, \ldots, 8 \) since these residues cover all possible cases for \( n \mod 9 \).

We compute \( x^3 \mod 9 \) for \( x = 0, 1, 2, \ldots, 8 \): \[
\begin{align*}
x \equiv 0 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 1 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 2 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 3 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 27 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 4 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 64 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 5 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 125 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 6 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 216 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 7 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 343 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 8 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 512 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}.

sentence: Since \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 4 \) or \( 7 \pmod{9} \) and \( x^3 \equiv 0, 1, 8 \pmod{9} \), there is no overlap between the possible values of \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) and \( x^3 \mod 9 \).

sentence: Therefore, there does not exist an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for any integer \( n \).
